title: Global Enterprise
description: This course uses economic tools to examine strategic aspects of competition and collaboration in an integrated global market.  Topics include the determinants and changes in the boundaries of global firms, competitive advantage and value creation, the nature of global markets, and strategic positioning in the global market place.

prerequisites: ECON 6100 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or (ECON 6105 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and ECON 6106 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)
